yogaPoses.name: Child's Pose
yogaPoses.description: Child's pose gently stretches the hips, thighs, and ankles. It relieves back and neck pain when done with head and torso supported

yogaPoses.name: Seated Cat/Cow
yogaPoses.description: This pose creates a more flexible spine, reduces back, neck and shoulder tension, facilitates deeper breathing, strenghens the back

yogaPoses.name: Supported Bridge
yogaPoses.description: In addition to the relaxation effects, Supported Bridge Pose stretches the hip flexors, expands the chest. It can also be helpful for digestion

yogaPoses.name: Reclining Bound Angle
yogaPoses.description: This pose stimulates the heart and improves general circulation. It also stretches the inner thighs, groins, and knees. As well as helps relieve the symptoms of stress

yogaPoses.name: Thread the Needle
yogaPoses.description: This pose creates a stretch that opens the shoulders and stretches the spine. The pose can also help relieve chronic shoulder or back pain

yogaPoses.name: Supine Spinal Twist
yogaPoses.description: This twist stretches the glutes, chest, and obliques. Because of the chest stretch, it is considered a heart opener

yogaPoses.name: Legs Up the Wall
yogaPoses.description: Legs up the wall pose helps relieve tired legs and feet, gently stretches your hamstrings and back of the neck, and may help ease mild backache

yogaPoses.name: Supported Fish
yogaPoses.description: This reclining pose stretches the muscles and fascia of the chest, shoulders, abdominals and neck. This pose can also help reduce anxiety

yogaPoses.name: Happy Baby
yogaPoses.description: Happy Baby is a gentle stretch for the hamstrings, inner thigh, and inner groin, a relaxation exercise for the back, and it also opens up the hips, shoulders, and chest

meditations.name: Loving Kindness
meditations.description: This meditation focuses on unconditional love without expectations

meditations.name: Mindfulness
meditations.description: In mindfulness meditation, you simply observe and take note of any patterns

meditations.name: Focused
meditations.description: Focused meditation involves concentration using any of the five senses

meditations.name: Movement
meditations.description: This practice may include walking through the woods, gardening, qigong, and other gentle forms of motion

meditations.name: Mantra
meditations.description: This type of meditation uses a repetitive sound to clear the mind

meditations.name: Transcendental
meditations.description: This practice is for those who like structure and are serious about maintaining a meditation practice

meditations.name: Progressive Relaxation
meditations.description: Also known as body scan meditation, progressive relaxation is a practice aimed at reducing tension in the body and promoting relaxation

meditations.name: Visualization
meditations.description: Visualization meditation is a technique focused on enhancing feelings of relaxation, peace, and calmness by visualizing positive scenes or images

meditations.name: Spiritual
meditations.description: Spiritual meditation is used in Eastern religions, such as Hinduism and Daoism, and in Christian faith

breathingExercises.name: Box Breathing
breathingExercises.description: This breathing exercise can heighten performance and concentration while also being a powerful stress reliever

breathingExercises.name: Alternate Nostril
breathingExercises.description: Alternate nostril breathing involves blocking off one nostril at a time as you breathe through the other, alternating between nostrils in a regular pattern

breathingExercises.name: Belly Breathing
breathingExercises.description: Belly breathing helps you relax, lowering the harmful effects of the stress hormone cortisol on your body

breathingExercises.name: Pursed Lip Breathing
breathingExercises.description: Pursed lip breathing helps control shortness of breath, and provides a quick and easy way to slow your pace of breathing, making each breath more effective
The 4-7-8 technique forces the mind and body to focus on regulating the breath, and are useful for combating anxiety because they help fortify the connection between mind and body

breathingExercises.name: Lion's Breath
breathingExercises.description: Lion’s Breath not only stretches the muscles in your face, but it also relieves tension and tightness while improving circulation. It’s an energetic and awakening breath that will also help to ease the mind

breathingExercises.name: Resonant Breathing
breathingExercises.description: Resonant breathing is the practice of slowing your breathing rate to approximately six breaths per minute. This requires complete control over your breathing

breathingExercises.name: Humming Bee Breath
breathingExercises.description: Bee breath gives you instant way to relieve tension, anger and anxiety. People suffering from hypertension should practice this breathing technique as it calms down the agitated mind

breathingExercises.name: Ocean Breath
breathingExercises.description: has a balancing influence on the entire cardiorespiratory system and the nervous system. Practicing Ocean Breathing helps calm the mind and body

journalEntries.journalLog: Doing my exercises today really helped lower my anxiety. I am excited to see my progess next week.
